content:
My organization is large, and diverse. However, we're all working from the same general ontology (meaning a hierarchy of topics), so it would be helpful to my users to have several (but not many) hierarchy-based streams. In Zulip terms, it means having sub-topics of topics, and sub-topics of other sub-topics farther up the hierarchy. Is that possible?

If we can't have such a hierarchy (because the community doesn't want to mess up everyone else), is there some workaround?
We only support two levels of hierarchy at the core level. Careful naming conventions for either streams or topics can go a long way to help.

Yeah, we're aware of that, but it doesn't really help. We would have hundreds of streams, and for many new users, that's overwhelming.

I think we'll just have to come up with another solution.
I'd still love to see prefix-matching for stream and topic search.
